page.title: 16Religion in Caerhun Parish
page.content: The older members of the community take an active part in church and chapel. The young inhabitants are not at all anti-religion but they feel there is little there to motivate them. Only a few attend services and as a result there is a sharp drop in membership. There is a Welsh Congregational Chapel at the upper end of Rowen village. The building is in good condition but the congregation is small, numbering only six. There is no minister in charge of the chapel and there are no longer weekday meetings. Members meet one Sunday each month. Some residents belong to Caerhun or Llangelynin churches. Salem chapel at Llanbedr-y-cennin has been converted into a private house.
